newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian gross harvest so far 67.8 mln tonnes.
newsitem.headline: Russian gross harvest so far 67.8 mln tonnes.

text.p: Russia's poor grain harvest is drawing to a close and gross (bunker weight) grain output so far is 67.8 million tonnes, Interfax news agency quoted an Agriculture Ministry official as saying on Tuesday.
Ivan Gridasov, head of the ministry's crop growing section, said 41.6 million hectares sown to grain had been threshed and less than 600,000 hectares remained to be harvested.
Six million hectares had been damaged by poor weather and produced grain suitable only for livestock.
Average yields were 1.70 tonnes per hectare, a slight improvement on last year's 1.63 tonnes.
Western Siberia, where the harvest has been particularly slow, had threshed only 5.9 million hectares compared to 8.4 million at this time last year.
The harvest in Eastern Siberia was also behind schedule.
Gridasov said moisture levels in grain in these areas were 25-30 percent and farmers were experiencing a severe lack of harvesting equipment and materials.

Winter grain crops had already been sown to 13.4 million hectares, which was 787,000 hectares below the area sown at this time last year. Nearly 32 million hectares had been ploughed for spring sowing, lagging year-ago levels by 4.8 million hectares.
The St Petersburg Vedomosti newspaper said grain output in the Leningrad region was 15 percent below year-ago levels, but gave no absolute figures.
Russia is facing its second poor net grain harvest in a row. Last year's official net output was 63.4 million tonnes, the worst in three decades.
